publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2571 Michael McMahon: Hamilton Fairtrade Town—That the Parliament congratulates the town of Hamilton for achieving Fairtrade Town status; recognises that this was the result of the hard work and dedication of ordinary members of the community, South Lanarkshire Council officials, staff and pupils in the town’s schools and the local co-operative movement, and notes that this recognition indicates the increasing awareness of the need to promote fair trade across Scotland.

S2M-2571 Michael McMahon: Hamilton Fairtrade Town—That the Parliament congratulates the town of Hamilton for achieving Fairtrade Town status; recognises that this was the result of the hard work and dedication of ordinary members of the community, South Lanarkshire Council officials, staff and pupils in the town’s schools and the local co-operative movement, and notes that this recognition indicates the increasing awareness of the need to promote fair trade across Scotland. Supported by: Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Jackie Baillie*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) John Swinburne*, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Pauline McNeill*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-2571 Hamilton Fairtrade Town (lodged on 10 March 2005) Bill Butler*
